FILE: cm450475v11.0.txt
DYAD: LIBERIA - NIGERIA
RIVALRY: RIV1071
DISPUTE(S): MID4255 MID4256 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190216
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190216

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4255

TERRMID: MID4255 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4255 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4255 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4255 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4255 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4255 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4255 from cm narrative and Gibler 2018, Nigeria entered Liberian territory to arrest Sierra Leonean officials. Sierra Leone did not protest the arrest. Liberia protested the border violation, resulting in this MID. From Xinhua News Agency 2/14/1998, the arrested officials were fleeing the civil war ongoing in Sierra Leone. Coded civil war link because this was connected to the civil war in Sierra Leone, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4255 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4255 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4255 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4256

TERRMID: MID4256 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4256 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4256 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4256 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4256 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID4256 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4256 from cm narrative and Gibler 2018, Nigeria and Sierra Leone threatened to use force against Liberia if it continued supplying arms to Sierra Leonean rebels. In response, Liberia sent troops to its border. Coded civil war link because this was connected to the civil war in Sierra Leone, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4256 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4256 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4256 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4255
rivalry=450475 nationa=NIGERIA nationb=LIBERIA MID4255 19980200-19980200 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Nigeria entered Liberian territory to arrest Sierra Leonean officials. Sierra Leone did not protest the arrest. Liberia protested the border violation, resulting in this MID. First and last day of dispute was on 2/00/1998.

MID4256
rivalry=450475 nationa=NIGERIA nationb=LIBERIA MID4256 19990409-19990409 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=THREAT TO USE FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=DISPLAY OF FORCE 

Nigeria and Sierra Leone threatened to use force against Liberia if it continued supplying arms to Sierra Leonean rebels. In response, Liberia sent troops to its border. First and last day of dispute was on 4/9/1999.

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield. 
Xinhua News Agency (1998). Liberia recalls ambassador to nigeria. Xinhua News Agency February 14. LexisNexis.
